decks.notes: The main focus of this Modern Goblin Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide, Foundry Street Denizen, and Legion Loyalist, coupled with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Grenade, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Devastating Summons provide additional burst damage, while Grim Lavamancer helps control the board. The mana base of fetch lands ensures consistent color access for the deck's spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful board state and utilize various pump spells and protective spells to make your infect creatures lethal and hard to deal with. The deck aims to win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent through quick and efficient attacks with infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Plague Stinger, supported by pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Become Immense. The deck also includes disruption in the form of spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Fatal Push to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand, while also utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Dismember to remove threats on the board. The creatures in the deck, such as Death's Shadow, Gurmag Angler, and Snapcaster Mage, are used aggressively to quickly bring the opponent's life total down. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and removal, while also applying pressure with its aggressive creatures to swiftly end the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards by discarding them from hand, enabling strong graveyard-based interactions that allow for explosive plays and creating a steady stream of threats. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to draw and discard cards, along with Life from the Loam to bring lands back from the graveyard. This enables the deck to consistently recur powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast, creating a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and aggressive threats.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of cheap artifacts to power up Cranial Plating and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana early on, the deck aims to deploy threats like Vault Skirge, Signal Pest, and Arcbound Ravager rapidly. The inclusion of cards like Welding Jar and Bomat Courier provides protection and card advantage, while Contested War Zone allows for additional pressure. The deck's synergy and explosiveness make it a formidable force in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on combining the abilities of Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to ramp up mana quickly and search for key lands and creatures. By using cards like Sakura-Tribe Scout and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, the deck aims to play Primeval Titan as early as possible to fetch lands like Boros Garrison and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion for a lethal attack. The Engineered Explosives and Walking Ballista provide some removal options while Pact of Negation protects the combo from disruption. The key is to efficiently use the mana ramp to overwhelm the opponent with big threats.

This UR Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and bounce effects while setting up its win condition of flipping Thing in the Ice or controlling the board with Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Blood Moon is used to disrupt opponents' mana bases, while versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command provide flexibility in handling threats. The deck also includes card draw and selection to ensure consistency in finding key cards. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and out-value the opponent.

The main concept revolves around quickly infecting your opponent with small, evasive creatures like Glistener Elf and Plague Stinger, while protecting them with spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense. Using pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Become Immense, along with the poison counters from Phyrexian Crusader, you can deal lethal damage in a single attack. Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help disrupt your opponent's game plan, while Noble Hierarch helps ramp up your mana for more aggressive plays. The deck aims to win swiftly and decisively through the infect mechanic.

This fast-paced, aggressive deck is focused on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. With a mix of burn spells and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the goal is to reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize. The mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells, while cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide additional reach and versatility. Overall, this deck aims to win the game swiftly through constant pressure and burn spells.

This deck focuses on quickly playing Death's Shadow by getting your own life total as low as possible through cards like Street Wraith and fetch lands. Once Death's Shadow is on the battlefield, you can pump it up even further with cards like Temur Battle Rage and Ghor-Clan Rampager. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control your opponent's hand, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with threats on the board. The goal is to be aggressive and finish off the opponent before they can establish their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, then use cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting to dredge them back and trigger effects like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast to put pressure on the opponent. The goal is to create a powerful graveyard-based engine that can overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats, making it difficult for them to keep up with the sheer value and card advantage generated by the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It seeks to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up its own resources and eventually winning with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes land destruction and efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage to maintain board control. By efficiently managing its spells and resources, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

This deck focuses on playing cheap aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for attacks. The deck is capable of quickly applying pressure to the opponent and using cards like Lingering Souls to maintain a consistent threat level. Blood Moon can also disrupt opponent's mana base, giving the deck an advantage in some matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption spells, while also generating an army of tokens through cards like Lingering Souls and Young Pyromancer. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with these creatures and finish the game quickly, while also controlling the opponent's resources through cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil, creating a well-rounded aggro strategy that can adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on assembling the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. It uses control elements like Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust to clear the board, while also running threats like Wurmcoil Engine and World Breaker to pressure opponents. The deck aims to stabilize the board early on with cheap artifacts and land tutors, before slamming down game-ending threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Additionally, it includes graveyard hate in the form of Relic of Progenitus to disrupt opponent's strategies.

The key strategy of this UW Control deck is to maintain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with removal spells like Path to Exile and board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict. The deck also aims to draw cards and generate advantage with cards like Opt, Snapcaster Mage, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The inclusion of counterspells like Negate and Mana Leak further enhances the control aspect of the deck, while cards like Search for Azcanta provide card selection and filtering. The win condition comes from finishing off the opponent with powerful threats like Entreat the Angels or Celestial Colonnade.
